rooms.name: Entrance Hall
rooms.description: A spacious entrance with reception area following Vastu principles to welcome positive energy.

rooms.name: Open-plan Kitchen and Living Area
rooms.description: Design incorporates Brutalist elements with exposed concrete finishes, large floor-to-ceiling windows for natural light, integrated kitchen space with open living area ensuring connectivity between spaces.

rooms.name: Studio Apartment Suite 1 (Master Suite)
rooms.description: A private suite featuring a bedroom and attached en-suite bathroom. Emphasis on privacy with Vastu-aligned positioning for the bed and seating areas.

rooms.name: Guest Suite
rooms.description: Secondary living space designed to accommodate visitors, with minimalist design and clear circulation paths.

openings.details: Reinforced concrete door in line with the entrance hall following Vastu alignment.
Large windows along exterior wall for maximum natural light, enhancing open-plan design.
Dedicated entry point for servant's quarters aligning with local building norms.

rooms.name: Servant Quarters
rooms.description: A modest living space for domestic help, complete with basic amenities. Designed with privacy and functionality in mind.

rooms.name: Studio Apartment Suite 2 (Additional Studio)
rooms.description: Another studio layout for flexible usage or rental purposes, following a similar design ethos as the ground floor master suite.

openings.details: A reinforced concrete staircase providing access between levels. Includes an emergency exit window on each landing following Vastu guidelines for safety.
Window for natural light and ventilation in the servant quarters.

rooms.name: Studio Apartment Suite 3 (Additional Studio)
rooms.description: A studio designed for versatile use, either as a private living space or an additional rental unit. Adheres to Brutalist aesthetics with concrete finishes and large windows.

openings.details: Outdoor balcony providing access to the studio, ensuring natural ventilation per Vastu guidelines.
Window for emergency exit, aligned with building safety norms and local regulations.
